website_summaries.verdict: Durable and stylish, this drive is able to do it all, but not very quickly.
pros: The outer casing is easy to grip, while rubber corners keep the drive safe from drops
It still manages to look thin and feel light, despite its rugged design, making it great for storage in the office or on-the-go
cons: Below-average transfer speeds for a USB 3.0 device
The built-on cable holder doesn't work well enough to be considered useful

customer_reviews.title: Use it for more than 2 years now and still works
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in August 2014, and it is now May of 2017. Fortunately it still works and has never given me any problems. the sides where you can attach the USB cord is genius and convenient! I travel with this everywhere, so sometimes it gets bumped on the plane, fall on the cement, etc. so I am lucky that it is shock proof. I am planning on buying naother, and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Eunice

customer_reviews.title: I threw it on the floor 5 times and it still works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The most durable hard drive I have ever had. I even bought on for my wife. Check out my review video for more details. Definitly Radar approved!
customer_reviews.author: On the Radar

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in September so that I could store all my photos on it for my class. Today is my final and I need my photos to turn in. Guess what.... IT NO LONGER WORKS. Waste of money. It lasted almost 3 months if that. Do not purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool at the right price
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm with no drama. It's my archived data storage M-14 now (except the magazine does not drop out when you least expect it). . Whatever you do, never ever forget to format your new external hard drive or USB stick prior to loading data onto it unless you want to spend three days finding out how to use freeware data retrieval programmes. Sounds obvious but it is easy to forget to do so. You only forget to do so when you load essential data onto it then your computer tells you that it cannot read the external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but only has a life (for me) of around 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great, but only for a year :( . Luckily, I was able to do "First Aid" on it, and backed it up at the first sign of issues. My mac book wasn't registering the hard drive in my finder, and it was not letting me mount it manually. I did use it a few times a week, so maybe that is why it did not last as long as my back-up drives (which I use 4 times a year). But I used it, and took it everywhere for a year, and it worked great. If you get it, make sure you back it up, especially when your hitting close to 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: BAN

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: So I only used this to back up some important files and memories. Luckily it's a backup, so I didn't lose everything. It will only work for a very VERY short time right after plugging it in now, and will just stop working after that. Can't access or write. Get something else, these are not worth your time, especially if you need to save important things.
customer_reviews.author: Kyosji

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer After Eaten by Puppy
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these for over a year, and I use them about once a week. When not in use, they sit unplugged. I had one that I had to reformat because it didn't always show up on my desktop, but that has not reoccured. In all, super solid and consistent. Read/write speeds are not critical for me, but I have never felt like these were slow. My puppy managed to get his teeth on both of them for an entire day — he severed all the cables with ease; one HD had scratches in it, and the other had an entire corner ripped off. With new cables, both still function!
customer_reviews.author: DJ OK Potato

customer_reviews.title: VERY high quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic external hard drive. I use this to store my massive collection of movies, shows and my photos/videos. I have had this plugged in for many hours a day every day for months playing videos straight off of it and have had no over heating issues or any other problems. I am quite impressed and surprised at how reliable this hard drive has been. I have dropped it onto my hard wood floors and spilled coffee on it twice and it wasn't even phased. I would definitely recommend buying this to anyone in need of a tough and reliable external hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: After several months of dealing with this drive working when it apparently feels like it, I have figured out that this drive will only show up on my computers when I restart them. Even if you use the eject hardware option. This is USELESS as a back up portable hard drive when you have to restart EVERY time you want to use it or try to carry your laptop with it attached. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY. If I could give this ZERO stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Martin

customer_reviews.title: Corrupt files after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Was quite happy with it for a while but for the last two months reading errors started to happen and files disappeared. The situation escalated fast and now I'm dealing with a whole series of AutoCAD files that are corrupt and no longer readable or fixable. Very annoying and costly as I ended up having to redo a bunch of work from another back-up file. Before this hard drive I had a smaller one from WD for many many years! Always carried it in my bag and it got banged up and dropped several times but NEVER had an issue with it. Reverting back to WD as we speak!
customer_reviews.author: I. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, but started failing off the bat, I needed to transfer files and documents, it was really really slow, and halfway through started saying that there was an error code and many of the docs couldn't be transmitted , after 6 hours of trying to transfer 64gb of doc I found out that only half of them were actually on the drive,I just could not risk it failing on me, it's going back tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: Monifa

customer_reviews.title: Not for mission critical backups or storage for Mac--DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Not the best external drive for a Mac...having issues with it dropping off spontaneously, chattering noises. Would not recommend as a mission-critical backup source, and most certainly would not buy again. Not recommended and would have returned if not 3 days past return window. UPDATE: Did the dance with Silicon Power via email: bottom line? If you want a refund, do not even bother with Silicon Power. i recontacted Amazon and graciously got a full refund...using magnets to chew the data left before returning. Its garbage and although YMMV, sooner or later *read the other reviews* it is going to fail and leave you in the lurch.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Malware warning
customer_reviews.text: Pre-loaded HTML contains a link to a website that Google's safety checker doesn't like: "The site silicon-power.com contains harmful content, including pages that: Contain unwanted or malicious software" There are plenty of other drives to choose from. If you buy one of these, turn off auto-detect/auto-run before plugging it in. The pre-loaded stuff looks like it's necessary to register the device, but I wasn't going to chance it. I ran a FULL format (took a couple hours), and then copied about 100GB of files to it - and it seems fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - DRIVE FAILED AFTER A FEW MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: The drive completely failed after 4 months.... Luckily I was using this as a backup device for my laptop content, and did not lose my work. However, when I tried to copy from this drive to another PC later, it failed completely. Later I reformatted the drive and it is working again, but my trust level has been deeply shaken.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when arrived....But
customer_reviews.text: The product didn't work straight out of the box (DOA), no function whatsoever. So I got in touch with tech support and they tried to solve the issue but eventually they sent a replacement (I was impressed by the tech support customer service). The item was physically in perfect condition it seemed that something internally had gone wrong. The replacement worked as advertised but I feel uneasy trusting this hardrive as the only place to back up my important files for my workflow.
customer_reviews.author: andrea medford

customer_reviews.title: No Rugged.
customer_reviews.text: Drive did not even last 6 months. This is not a rugged drive at all. I've dropped regular hard drives from several feet and had no issues but this fell one foot and now won't power on.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Kelly

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good (mostly)
customer_reviews.text: I've just had this device for a few days, and it's working like a champ so far. I like the exterior design, and the (reputed) robustness of its shock proofing. The only bone I've got to pick with this drive is its interface -- it uses a USB 3.0 A-to-A cable, which is pretty unusual. So it's good that the case includes cable management clips, because if you lose the cable when you're on a trip somewhere, you may have trouble finding a replacement. Of course, they're easily / cheaply purchased on Amazon and other online sites, but I'd rather not have to carry yet another spare cable on my trips to the boonies.
customer_reviews.author: E. Seale

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this drive soo much. But after a little more than a year, it just stopped functioning. I may loose all of my files, and/or I will have to pay a pretty penny to get my files back. ALL I can say is that you better make sure you back up important files elsewhere, so that you don't lose them!
customer_reviews.author: Candice King

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it worked
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked for 4 years, then stopped being recognized on 3.0 USB ports and now, it is failing in 2.0 USB ports also.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Great product all around !
customer_reviews.text: I have a small computer business and suggest external drives all the time for my clients that have so much to loose if their computers take a crap ... so yes I push these external drives all the time ... I used to use the Transend but I like these more because if the USB being the same universal large end on both sides unlike the Transend being the small form factor on t he device end and not holding up as well as these Silicon Power's do ! Thanks again Amazon ... great product for the money too !
customer_reviews.author: William R Naggy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory solution
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE - more than three years of use on the first of the two I have. Both have been used as file backup drives and normally protected in semi-hard shell cases. Both are still working fine. Like all the cool kids I've gone to multiple redundancy for important file backups. Original: Have used mine (I have two) on travel for more than two years and they have done well for multiple redundancy backup. When the prices for equivalent capacity SSD devices come down, I'll probably move that way. But for the time being these have been reliable and decently quick even with USB 2.0 interfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Escéptico

customer_reviews.title: Only comes with USB A and 3rd party for USB C is not compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed. 😩 the Toshiba brand broke on me I figured maybe I needed a rugged one. The (major) downfall for this one is you cannot use any 3rd party cable. I looked through questions for this listing and some say you can’t either. I was hopefully and tried about 10 different cables!!!! I’m done. I’m finding a new drive. If it’s for MacBooks too, there should be consideration to provide a USB A to C cable. Still shaking my head in Disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Phanessa

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after barely using it for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! I bought this in March, and 5 months later (of barely using it except to copy all my back up files onto it once) it's stopped working. Slow and won't let me see my files. Had to take it to my IT guy at work and he was able to salvage my files for me. Explained it had a spinning disk inside which is older technology. Spend more money and go for one without the spinning disk. This product is useless.
customer_reviews.author: GoldFish123

customer_reviews.title: Im so happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: To me when it come to extrnal hard drive especially 500GB and above I really foucs on having a good quality one because Im sure it would be a big lose if that drive ever decided not work someday with all my data stored inside it, this one I got and expected to not functioning after a year or two but I found it went through so much with me moving, traveling use the attached cable so many times and yes it still going fine.
customer_reviews.author: 90's boy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not even a whole week and the hard drive has started making a ticking sound and is running considerable slower than when I first used it. I have used the hard no more than 3-4 times. You are supposed to get 1TB but instead mine was reduced down to around 900 which is crazy because it doesn't take that much storage to load system information. I don't recommend this hard drive for the reason described.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive because I was quickly running out of space on my PS4's internal storage. The drive was easy to set up, and I had no issues transferring my game data. Games actually seem to run faster off the external drive than they do on internal memory. I've been using it fairly heavily for a week, and it seems very stable and reliable thus far. Will update if any issues arise.
customer_reviews.author: N. L. Blight

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It appears that this "rugged" drive succumbed to a design flaw in that the enclosure has some rigged bars that brace against the metal drive enclosure. They were pressed against the metal which put pressure on the disk which caused a failure. I loosened all the screws on the inside metal case and the spindle started to spin and I can retrieve the data but I can not put this back together and have it work. I will pull my data off and on to something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: noseriously

customer_reviews.title: Not very amused with these. Mine fell, running ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very amused with these. Mine fell, running, about 2ft onto carpet and attached to the cord that I caught and slowed it's fall, but still died. They replaced it under warranty but I lost some work and was without my school drive for a couple weeks. All drives are shockproof when they're not running, I bought these because I thought they'd be safe from accidents while running, apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I love having an external HD that is larger than my PCs HD, I mainly use this for all of my video clips and edits for my GoPro, because it accumulates data pretty fast when you use it a lot.. this helps to relieve my PC of having to carry all of that data. Hopefully it lasts me years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Bergen

customer_reviews.title: Best Portable Drive for Editing Short Films Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these drives. I now own three of them. I love that they don’t require a separate power cable. I love the rubberized sides so they can take some light dropping without breaking. I love that the little USB cord grips onto the side. It’s easy to hand this off to someone without having to separately bundle up and rubber band a cord. It’s all one nice handy package and it talks to my PC and my friends’ Macbooks without any trouble after I formatted it to exFAT. If this form factor came in bigger sizes like 8 TB, I would buy one in a heartbeat. In the meantime, I’ll settle for three of these 2 TB ones.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust it with Valuable info!!!
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of use and tons of irreplaceable data collected, the hard drive just decided to not be readable by any of my Mac computers, although I had formatted it correctly prior to use. Disk utility was not able to fix it and have to now resort to costly data recovery software to try and salvage what was on there. I have used tons of hard drives over the years and this is a first. I will never trust SP's hard drive again!
customer_reviews.author: Eyebot

customer_reviews.title: Stellar quality; sturdy and rugged.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Stellar quality; sturdy and rugged. I'm a DJ and use this during my gigs and believe me, this product can definite take a hit or drop. Very nice design; the cord attachment slots around the device are great, nice and snug. I've had this drive for a while now and I haven't encounter any problems as of yet. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LjB

customer_reviews.title: It keeps changing in Win 10
customer_reviews.text: This drive Might be detected for 15-35 seconds when you plug it it to a USB port (3.0) and then it vanishes from File Explorer and Device Manager see's it as a Unknown USB device that will not load plus be flagged with errors. Buy a Wester Digital, Seagate, or a Big name brand, this drive makes a better paper weight than a storage device.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K.

customer_reviews.title: Design and speed - OK. No comments on durability and dependency
customer_reviews.text: Just got it - so can't comment on durability and dependency. Design is good. Speed is good - they don't provide actual speed specification. I copied few hundred GB on it and the average speed was 60-70 MB/s. The only thing - I reformatted it to NTFS, while it was originally FAT32, as I think. Not sure if I was right about it but otherwise it didn't allow me to copy some of my files because their size "exceeded limits for disk's format".
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: good price, handy for backups
customer_reviews.text: like - 1 TeraByte storage in palm of the hand, less than 8 ounces, plug and play, no external power needed (powered from USB), comes with cable, 3-meter drop test (can be used to kill spiders, roaches, or earwigs.) Good price. Compare with second image, 1956 drum memory (5 MegaByte) loading onto a Pan Am Clipper - probably not free shipping, probably more than $49 delivered - could be used to crush small cars.
customer_reviews.author: capn sticky

customer_reviews.title: Just received and been using about a week with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I have this portable hardrive using with my ACER Chromebook 15 inch laptop and it works without a hitch or hiccup. I didn't have to format or anything. I am using to try and consolidate a lot of video and music. Transfers are fast and seamless. From what I know up to this point I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: My Armor Silicon 1 tb external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I only have antenna tv so I purchased a digital recorder unit. After getting the digital recorder then realized also needed to get a external hard drive for the unit thinking all I needed was the digital box, wrong! So I got back on amazon and did some searching for external hard drives and in my search found this to be the best one for the price. It comes with a usb cord and just plug into your digital recorder and ready to go! It records and plays back my tv programs perfectly. I do recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Davis

customer_reviews.title: Dead within a year
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to format or modify, don't know if it's a SATA issue or what but it's completely unusable. Spent hours waiting for it to decrypt, with cmd failing to format it, various programs, and even trying to delete the drives Extremely aggravating would not recommend and actively warn friends and family against it
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Good storage unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy storage unit. Pros: Short USB cable is provided. The cable stores on the drive itself. The drive is rugged and designed to survive drops Cons: There are no rubber or silicone feet provided on the drive, so it tends to slide around when I'm trying to use it with my laptop, and it ends up dangling in by the USB cable. Good thing it is designed to survive drops.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Well built storage bank
customer_reviews.text: A nice overbuilt storage unit with the ability to withstand dropping and other minor mishaps.the cable storage is just clips built in the padding and functions well. We bought it for our son to use with his PS4 for storage. The unit does it's job and works just like it's supposed to. Great price , great product , recommended !!
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: at 2 weeks has been woring perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have two units which I received in a very timely manner. I had to use tech support to get some clarification on the registration process. It was prompt and accurate. I extended the 1 year warranty to 3 years when I registered the product. I do daily backups using both Time Machine and a cloning software (SuperDuper!) on one unit for a week, switch units from an offsite location, and then repeat the process. So far it has worked flawlessly. I have confidence that the rubber bumper design of the edges will, within reason, provide good protection if dropped. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I'll start this review by saying that my PS3 recognizes this drive (due to being FAT32), so that alone has made this a must have product for me! I'm ecstatic to have this type of capacity in such a rugged design. Add to the fact that it's usb 3.0 and uses standard usb connections on the unit itself, and I'm challenging myself to find something negative about it from the get go. So far, highly recommended and the deal that I got on this sealed it for me. Very nice product that I feel comfortable carrying around in my backpack while I ride my bike through the city. Not worried about damaging the unit. What else do I need?
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Mincey

customer_reviews.title: Got 3 uses from this junk.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in October 2015. I have literally used it 3 times since - I.e plugged it into my computer 3 times. The 3rd time I did it, it randomly stopped working and I am unable to gain access to any of my backed up files....which I deleted off my computer. This is a huge problem and I am pissed as well as freaking out. The drive has had 0 shock, been sitting in my desk drawer. I have tried it on 2 laptops with no luck, it just won't recognize the drive anymore even though the blue light is on. I'd stay away from this piece of junk....
customer_reviews.author: JP12345

customer_reviews.title: Not military shock proof rated
customer_reviews.text: I knocked my laptop of the table and the hard drive was attached and fell with it. So approximately a 2 1/2 foot fall. Laptop was fine, thankfully, but the hard drive was done. No visible damage but could no longer access anything on it, so clearly the drive was internally damaged. I took it to my IT department to screw around with and see if they could recover anything, negative. So, for a product that touts military shock proof strength, it failed miserably.
customer_reviews.author: L Odell

customer_reviews.title: Best Alternative to High Capacity USB Drive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a much smaller thumb drive and only needed 500 MB of space. However, I would have paid a lot more to get that so this reliable larger drive was the best alternative. I have another one just like it that I've used for years with no problem. Wish I had been using it rather than the 4TB hard drive I dropped and broke. Not a big deal reformating to NTFS. Took me about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous ConsumerTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Corupt
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month it became curupt. Contacted Microsoft whose technical assistance helped identify this drive as curupted. I quickly disconnected it from my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Parrott

customer_reviews.title: In love completely!
customer_reviews.text: I was really reluctant on buying this item at first. Such a low price, I thought it would break, most 1TB items are up to 100$. But this beauty has been great! I use it for my xbox mostly for the games I download, but I do use my laptop with it for documents. I will tell other people about this! Thanks guys, I might buy from you again! Keep it up! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Javon

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included
customer_reviews.text: I just received it. There are no instructions included in the box or on the box.
customer_reviews.author: MDG

customer_reviews.title: He said it was so small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was an early Christmas gift for my hubby. He LOVES it. He said it was so small and easy to use. He backed up files from his lap top and then about a week later he had problems with his laptop. He was so pleased that he had backed everything up the week before so he did not lose much data at all. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store more games on my PS4 and this did the trick PERFECTLY! There was no installation involved. Just plug it into the USB port on the PS4 and go into your settings to set it as your default storage. This thing is just right for more PS4 storage! It’s also small enough to fit in your pocket if needed to take it on the go! I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: StandupArtist69

customer_reviews.title: This is sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great external hard drive. I will purchase this one again when I fill up the 1TB of storage available. I've been using it a few months before I posted a review. I wanted to be certain. I would recommend the Amazon Basics External Hard Drive Case (Hard Case)The Hard Drive fits perfectly in it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Worked just once
customer_reviews.text: I moved all my data from one external device to this one. Started hearing an odd noise so I removed the drive. Plugged it in again and heard the noise (kind of a clicking sound) again and it will not load. Used it exactly once. Pretty frustrated and disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie DiBacco

customer_reviews.title: Great back up to have
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product after my husband found out that the hard drive on our IMac is likely to die soon. We wanted to have a back up for our several thousand downloaded songs and all our family pictures. This is super easy to set up and gives us the assurance that no matter what happens with our hard drive, our important things will be backed up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive for 7 months or so and have had no problems. It travels with me to job locations and I have exchanged this drive to share files between a Mac Book Pro and several PCs (desktop and laptops). It works seamlessly. I buy external drives every year and I will be getting another of this one.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and mobility. Very convenient cable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second drive this brand. I used my first drive more 2 yers, and for me it's perfect device. I'm a photographer. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. You'll end up with corrupt files.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hard-drive to transfer all my files. Spent three days transferring files, the appeared to transfer. Open ok, but as I plugged it into my new computer all the files were corrupted. This was a plug and play, but now I have lost all my family pictures and work documents. Don't buy this. Don't make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsula

customer_reviews.title: One fast fantastic Terrabyte transfer drive.
customer_reviews.text: Transferred 13,000 photo's in no time in one shot. One fabulous transfer gismo. Beats any thumb drive at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Grampa JoeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: SP Drives are the very best
customer_reviews.text: I currently own 6 SP Portable Drives, all of this type except 4 are 1 Tb and 2 are 2 Tb. I have had others and they have turned out not as tough and reliable. I am planning to put together a Wifi NAS with an additional 2 Tb and also get one of the 1 TB SSD drives to update my Dell 990 Desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Swede

customer_reviews.title: Very fast transfer rate and a very protable package.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for an external/backup drive to carry around in a backpack. Transfer rates were very good (125 MB/s average, peak rates to 175MB/sec and higher). Completely self-contained, which is very convenient. Normally a short USB cord is a hassle, but the compact form factor of the drive lets me just place the drive on the laptop itself.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Great external hard-drive
customer_reviews.text: This hard-drive is simple and easy to use, I bought the same drive over 4 years ago and use it nearly every day for work files and personal photos. I love it so much I made sure to get the same drive again, this new one is a back-up to the first since I travel with it often- in case anything happens... Great storage capacity, I use large photoshop files and have over 10,000 photos on it, and there’s still plenty of room for more. I love the rubber corners, great for durability and to keep the USB cord snug.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Durable and compact, Love it
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE it is compact and durable. I am the klutz and i will drop anything and fall anywhere. I can fall walking up or downstairs. Because I am always carrying things, this little baby has proven it's worth. So now when I take my daily tumbles, this little one it probably the only thing that survives without scratches or dings. You really can't go wrong with this little beauty.
customer_reviews.author: T Grill

customer_reviews.title: It's very good
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I needed and wanted With the extra security in knowing it was drop tested as well as a warranty I can rest easy The customer experience is top knotch and I'll be going to SP first if I ever need any like this again
customer_reviews.author: K. Manzione

customer_reviews.title: rugged, reliable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago to replace a WD external drive that relies on glitchy (and should be unnecessary) proprietary software. This drive is literally plug and play, no issues getting to work on any of my (PC) computers. I'm buying another, larger one to supplement it.
customer_reviews.author: LMc

customer_reviews.title: Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: A well designed, well constructed External Hard Drive. A nice feature is the activity light that illuminates Blue if the speed is USB 3.0 and Red if the speed is USB 2.0. More importantly, the notches around the drive for storing the cable is extremely useful. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a well-made HDD.
customer_reviews.author: RogerVersatile

customer_reviews.title: Great external drive.
customer_reviews.text: Like the drive. Works very fast and I can do an image of my PC 1TB SSD in about 40 minutes. Wish I had purchased the 2TB model, but that was my fail. This one will do a great job for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Albano

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother in law and wouldn't you know, the minute she disconnected it, she dropped it. Well, it came out just fine and was nice and study. Held up to about a 2.5 - 3 ft drop just fine. It's easy to connect, use and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED REVIEW: I've used this drive for quite some time now, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this drive for quite some time now, and I have zero complaints. It's fast, and so far, quite reliable. EDITED June, 2019: I purchased this external drive in August, 2016. Not quite 3 years later and, out of the blue, it has stopped working, completely. This drive was never moved away from a flat surface and used only 3-4 times each year to back up my MBP. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: Can't be trusted
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive for a few years. I only use it to store photos and videos from our phones and cameras. I've nowhere near maxed our the 1TB. We were going to be traveling internationally and I wanted to be able to back up our photos even with limited internet access on the move. But it is the S---l---O----W---E---S---T loading drive I've ever used. Right from the start, too. I am now in the very slow process of moving everything off of it on to my desktop hard drive because I don't trust this thing at all. I would never buy from SP again.
customer_reviews.author: The Quarantine masters

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a lot of hard drives due to the rough nature of my work. But since getting this hard drive it has survived numerous falls on my few different occasions and still works to perfection. If you are on the go a lot or maybe just clumsy from time to time this hard drive is really good pick. The USB to USB cable is also nice and has lasted longer than the traditional cables most hard drives have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Addition to PS4 for half the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kid** so many games not enough space** it's plug and play so no need to worry about set up, not much else to say, just adds a ton of space to your system @ half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Not Obama

customer_reviews.title: Not an SSD Drive And runs a segate Drive To Boot
customer_reviews.text: Ok i know This did not say it was an SSd but in this day and age i was expecting that it would be just a warning to all who read this but i am not knocking stars for that i am knocking a single star just because it uses a Seagate 1TB drive. i have had noting but problems with Seagate drive. Me personally will never use them for system backups as they keep failing on me i recommend using this just to transfer files like a jumbo flash drive or just as a backup that you have 3 other copy's of.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L.

customer_reviews.title: Drive is partitioned  :(
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be durable. However the drive has 2 partition. One is 32g and the other says unallocated with the remainder of gigabytes. I bought it to back up my computer so 32g is not large enough. I have not been able to access the unallocated partition or combine them.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am not impressed by this drive, and wouldn't buy one again. I should have returned it after the first day or two. I own many portable HD's , and this one is my least favorite. It is slow. Very slow. Slow to boot up and show up on my screen, slow to find files. (and it is no where near full). The USB connection in theory is fine with me except the way it fits into the drive itself is not well designed, it wiggles enough to disconnect easily--bad design for a portable HD used on the go. Maybe all of the company's thought went into making a tough outwr casing and not enough thought into the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Z

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Total Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing calls itself Rugged Armor Military Grade yet it's rendered completely useless from a two foot fall from a bed to a carpeted floor. Company also will not assist in data recovery. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: The storage size and portability is great, but always be sure to recheck the files you put in before disconnecting them. I tried to transfer a folder of images and the next time I checked them, the folder was empty. I had to retransfer all over again, so if you’re going to buy this product, always check!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Affordable, and USB Powered External Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The reasons that I bought another unit from Silicon Power are: 1. Bought their 1 TB version a couple of years ago and it works flawlessly - ran out of room. 2. Bought the 2 TB version this time in hopes of saving more stuph (photographs; RAW and processed mainly). 3. A primary caveat for me is that it's power by the USB cable - no external power needed which makes this perfect for traveling and backups for the "just in case". 4. It's reasonably priced too. Would definitely buy this product again and from this company. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Graphique

customer_reviews.title: Love This External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we needed for our Playstation System. I had purchased an internal hard drive and I couldn't get it to load. This External hard drive is the answer to all of our problems with storage
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, reformatted/erased (was prompted) and made my backup. Stash until I'm ready to back up again. Not practical to leave it plugged in to my laptop since I move around with that.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a traveler/backpacker
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new External hard drive for backpacking and traveling around the world as I take a lot of photos/videos. Needed something that is rugged and be able to handle “shaking” and work with my laptop in different weather environments. Love the cable carry mechanism and information transfers great with the USB 3.0. Got the 2 TB external hard drive so ready to put this thing into further use!
customer_reviews.author: bsiwecki0

customer_reviews.title: Trash. Buy something else!
customer_reviews.text: Wont accept any file transfers larger than 5 gb. Trash external!
customer_reviews.author: Wenseslado D. Cano

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and compact travel drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this travel drive for overseas trips. It is compact and sturdy. I also like the bright highlights (orange) which make it easier to locate in my luggage. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I was excited when I purchased this item. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I purchased this item. It held all of my photos for the past 15 years (over 20,000 photos). Unfortunately, the heavy duty outer casing was not strong enough to protect the documents held within. When plugged into a computer, the device lights up as if it works, however, it is no longer recognizable on any computer. Therefore I have lost 15 years of memories, on what I thought was a rugged military grade hard drive. This is so depressing.
customer_reviews.author: K Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need in one package
customer_reviews.text: Works great! You need strong internet for faster download speeds. Now my X box one has too many games! Lol
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Something I needed and use all the time
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is super easy to use and has a lot of space - spend the money if you need one it is worth it. Both myself and my husband have them. I use mine for school stuff that I do and he uses his for work. We have not had any issues and they can be used with a mac and/or a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Gorelenore

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy It! It stopped working after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hard-drive to use it as back-up just over year ago. Uploaded all important files and data on it. This year, after taxes, I decided to upload most recent data - and it did not work. None of my PCs can see this drive. I've contacted to Silicon Power, and they offered to fix it or replace it, but I have to send it to their office. YEAH, RIGHT! I'll send you all my CONFIDENTIAL data, so anyone can see it, or even use it. For sure I am going to risk it over $60 which I paid for this piece of junk. I'll buy another one, but no from Silicon Power.
customer_reviews.author: Leouser

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Worth it, Awesome . . .
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 2 weeks now and I absolutely love it!!! It is a true plug and "play" with no need for a damn power supply cord, No setups required, works on both Mac and Windows systems, Plus it is light enough to move around with. All in a nice shock proof cover. Now I haven't tested that out intentionally yet and I pray not too but it does looks and feels like it would survive it. I don't know about the transfer speed though. I'm patient enough that it does't matter too much to me. Hopefully I think I have found a new company to rely on for my storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: B Suleiman

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Now have 4 of them. Replacing all my other portables over time, because sometimes I travel with them. The other reason is that protecting data is extremely important to me, whether photos, document scans, and other irreplaceable info. Have owned a couple of them for over a year as continuous computer backups.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketroe

customer_reviews.title: Durable and high quality.  No problems to report.
customer_reviews.text: Good Solid Hard Drive, has worked every time I've tried it. Will be putting it into my safe once I get everything backed up (maybe I should do that now that the HD has been sitting out for many months now).
customer_reviews.author: HotRods4Ever

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive, simple design.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this guy for a year and half to store roughly 980gb of RAW photos and video. I haven't had an issue yet. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Mock

customer_reviews.title: Great design for a hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This has been going strong for me for over a year now. I bought it when I was in Afghanistan so it's been shipped around the world a couple times and it still works like new. While I haven't dropped it yet, the shock proof design (they say it's been tested) is the main reason I wanted this one. I've lost hard drives in the past from giving them a little bump and I didn't want to lose another. It really does seem to be a rugged hard drive and I anticipate many more years of use. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who plans on moving the thing from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$, worked great for over 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit since March 2016. In October 2019, it stopped working. Trying to figure out how to get access to my files. Had no warning. But, for three years, this has worked as described.
customer_reviews.author: psloveslife

customer_reviews.title: and it held up fine. Used it as a backup for my SD ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this drive overseas for two weeks in a backpack, and it held up fine. Used it as a backup for my SD cards to keep an extra copy of my photos around. Love the integrated USB cable and hooks around its edge.
customer_reviews.author: ToddDominey

customer_reviews.title: Portable storage on a budget
customer_reviews.text: It's no the fastest hard drive, but it cary this thing around with me all the time. I also love how the orange model has rubber feet that can also hold the included cable.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSG

customer_reviews.title: Useless. Literally.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these in order to use as a time machine backup for both my Macbook Pro, and my Wife's Macbook Air. The initial set-up and backup went fine. But when I tried to reconnect it to either machine for a second backup, it could not be read. I even hooked them up to an iMac, and it too could not see the drive. Totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bencharsky

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, good company
customer_reviews.text: Any hard drive that hasn't fail will fail. It's just what happens with these things. I actually bought two of these (the first one a friend borrowed and then was stolen) and they are pretty durable. Now I wouldn't want to drop test this but if it lands on the corners it should be fine. The cord holder on the side is a bit clunky and you will lose the cord if you keep it like that. Anyways it works great, works on both mac and pc, isn't loud, and is made from a decent material.
customer_reviews.author: sjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Between mac and pc is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal! I have a mac, my husband and son have a PC. Plug and play between them is priceless. This is the best value I could find, and it's not lacking in quality. It helps with computer efficiency a lot to have a place to store things that can easily be accessed from anywhere. I had stored everything on an external drive before, but I switched to mac, and now I can't access any of it without a middle man. Someone suggested this one to me so that wouldn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: I-C Household

customer_reviews.title: Big Storage, Small Price
customer_reviews.text: The Unit is very light easy to take along. The clips for the USB cable are a nice touch. I wanted to back up my laptop hard drive had to reformat SP Amour hard drive into NTFS format it does not let you back it up FAT32. No big deal reformatting took two minutes top. I recently installed a small SSD drive in the laptop which didn't leave me much space for storage, but with with this baby I can store all my files, music, Videos and more without having to worry about not having enough hard drive space. IT has four rubber corners and it's made tough for today's tough traveler made to last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pagan

customer_reviews.title: What more could you want in a compact drive
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the wife for traveling. Weather proof, shock proof, DROP proof (she tested this one). Great device, great unit, great price.
customer_reviews.author: RL. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Ruggedly portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to do full image backups of my home computers (using Macrium Reflect). I keep them at a friend's house, and just get them one at a time, leap-frog style, when it's time for monthly backups, then take it back there when I'm done. (Daily document/etc. backups are done with CrashPlan.) Anyway, these drives are rugged, so I don't feel like I have to baby it when transporting it. While the clipped on cable seemed a bit clunky at purchase, I now see it as a good thing, to have the cable attached so easily to the device it supports.
customer_reviews.author: J Gillman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Loved this item. With my traveling as much a I do with it, I definitely loved the sturdy build. Easy to use and everything was great. And then one day it just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

product_meta.title: Silicon Power 2TB Rugged Portable External Hard Drive Armor A30, Shockproof USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, Xbox and PS4, Black
product_meta.description:
Capacity:2TB

Military-grade Shockproof
Compliant with the U.S. military drop-test standards, Armor A30 is comprised of silicone material on the most vulnerable corners, building from the internal structure to the exterior, adding an extra shield to withstand crushes and shocks.

Hexagonal Pattern for Scratch Resistant
Armor A30 features a distinguished hexagonal pattern covering over the surface, which makes it more durable to any scratches or fractions.

Cable wrap-around design
The innovative slot design is especially equipped for simple cable carrying and storing by which you can easily wrap the cables around the drive.

Ultra-fast Transfer Speed
SuperSpeed USB 3.0 interface enables blazing-fast speed performance to quickly transfer large files including Full HD videos, high-resolution photos and great numbers of documents in seconds.

3-year Warranty
The Armor A30 is backed by a 3-year warranty that guarantees complete services and technical support.

Box Contains
1 x Silicon Power Armor A30 External Hard Drive
1 x USB 3.0 Cable
feature_bullets: SuperSpeed USB 3.0 interface, backward compatible with USB 2.0
Cable storage design for simple cable carrying
[For Windows User] The A30 is pre-formatted as NTFS, so you could use it directly on Windows. [For Mac Users] Reformatting will be required for Mac operating systems

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,617 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
